summary: The text discusses the regulations related to statistical data in Nepal, specifically the "Statistical Data Rules, 2080" published in the Nepal Gazette. It outlines the procedures for the production and management of national statistical data, including the establishment of a National Statistical System Coordination Committee. The rules also define the roles and responsibilities of various government bodies and agencies in ensuring the quality and standardization of statistical data production and dissemination.

summary: The text outlines the rules and regulations governing the operation of the Relief and Assistance Fund for individuals affected by accidents in Nepal. It references the provisions of the Government of Nepal's Administrative Procedures Act of 2013 and establishes the procedures for the establishment and operation of the Relief and Assistance Fund. The text also details the criteria for eligibility and the management committee responsible for overseeing the fund's operations.

If the Ministry sees fit to issue the required permit under sub-rule 3, it will be required to provide the framework permit according to the inquiry of Schedule 3 [(2)]. The district official will be required to give the permit in the manner that Manasib sees fit and to do the necessary inquiry. summary: The text discusses the regulation of hazardous chemicals and substances in Nepal, as per the Chemicals (Control) Rules, 2080. It outlines the procedures for obtaining permits for the production, distribution, and use of such substances, as well as the insurance requirements for individuals involved in these activities. The rules also specify the penalties for non-compliance and the process for seeking approval from the Ministry in case of any deviations from the regulations.

summary: The text discusses the regulation of hazardous and other chemical substances in Nepal under the Hazardous and Other Chemical Substances (Management) Act, 2079. It covers the production, distribution, use, and disposal of such substances, emphasizing the need for legal provisions to prevent adverse health effects on humans and the environment. The Act establishes the authority to issue permits for the production, sale, and distribution of these substances, with strict guidelines for obtaining and maintaining such permits. The Act also defines the roles and responsibilities of various regulatory bodies in overseeing the management of hazardous substances.
